item.title: Treasury head Scott Bessent says Jamie Dimon should relax about the bond markets: ‘For his entire career he’s made predictions…none of them have come true’
item.description: Rising interest rates on U.S. debt seem to back up Dimon’s concern about government spending, but the Treasury secretary says it’s not as bad as it se...

item.title: What you need to know about Moderna’s new COVID vaccine, just approved by the FDA
item.description: The shot had previously been approved for everyone 12 and older. Now, there are limits.

item.title: Ex-CEO of addiction-treatment center network charged with targeting journalists, including spray-painting their homes and throwing bricks through their windows
item.description: Eric Spofford, the founder and former CEO of Granite Recovery Centers, allegedly paid his friend $20,000 to vandalize their homes.

item.title: New York City’s Pride organizers are racing to fill a fundraising gap as PepsiCo, Nissan, and others retreat from DEI policies
item.description: Many U.S. corporations this year stopped supporting Pride events that celebrate LGBTQ+ culture and rights.

item.title: Mark Cuban says consumers may actually see lower prices due to tariff uncertainty as companies deal with the aftermath of stockpiling goods
